data.title: Fraunces Tavern Museum
data.text:
Physical description Oil painting on canvas. Clothing: medium blue jacket with decorative white/silver braiding embroidery and buttons on lapels: white vest with white buttons and pink and white designs; white stock and ruffle; black hat with decorative white braid and black ribbon under sitter's left arm. Background: exterior- medium grey with dark green tree over sitter's left sholder and by his right elbow.

Plaque on frame reads: "Proprietor of Fraunces Tavern 1762-1765 & 1770-1785 / Steward to President George Washington 1789 - 1794"

Was identified as Samuel Fraunces starting in 1913. But in 2017, this identification was called into question. Today, the Museum does not use this portrait to identify Samuel Fraunces.

Read more about the object: https://www.frauncestavernmuseum.org/samuel-fraunces-revealed
